title: Jet Cash
author: Jet Cash
content: As I have already posted, I'm in the throes of creating a new YouTube channel, and I want to include a variety of topics in this. Amongst others, this will include general basic education on Bitcoin, and also guidance and experiences of running a full node in a campervan. I'm so far way from conventional attitudes and beliefs, that I would appreciate some help from you guys. I can't even decide if I should shave off my beard for example. Obviously I want to appeal to as wide an audience as possible, but then I'm not prepared to compromise my beliefs and attitudes.I've started this thread in Meta, as I'm not sure which board to use to solicit opinions. My thoughts are that Bitcoin specific videos should go on the discussion board, but I need to make some general videios first, and I thouugh I might open those on the serious discussion board. Do you think this is the best approach?

comments.author: SmartGold01
comments.body: Quote from: Jet Cash on July 16, 2023, 11:34:22 AM I can't even decide if I should shave off my beard for example. Obviously I want to appeal to as wide an audience as possible, but then I'm not prepared to compromise my beliefs and attitudes.I think this doesn't affects your speaking and your general knowledge towards what you about giving to the general public, in as much as what you are saying is very informative and educative I don't think you should compromised your belief and way of attitudes. However my point are, give the general public what they needs to know about your speeches and point of learning from your audience as I believe no one cares to see your beard rather wanting to grasped every little opportunities that could possibly leads them to success and how to go about with their bitcoin and cryptocurrency journey.I can't wait to learn and hear from your videos.SmartGold01 cares!

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Don't shave off your beard just because the audience might like you more without it or you think they would. Stay true to what and who you really are. I am surprised you want to do this. I have always imagined you to be a hardcore privacy advocate.When you say "general videos first," what exactly do you mean with that and why would it not fit in any of the bitcoin boards?Educational content is always appreciated. Just imagine an audience that knows nothing and needs everything explained in an easy to understand way. I would stay away from too much technical jargon unless it's really vital to the content. And please announce your YouTube channel somewhere. I would be interested to watch the stuff you release.

Amongst others, this will include general basic education on Bitcoin, and also guidance and experiences of running a full node in a campervan. I always thought that there should be a channel specific to Bitcoin from someone who has enough knowledge about it, and I truly believe that you're among those people who understand a lot about Bitcoin and that's why you can educate others very well about Bitcoin without any doubt. comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Does look really matter?How you look and appear to the audience is only relevant when the video is all about a pageant or modeling show. In your kind of YouTube channel, which is mainly focused on sharing informative and educational information, what matters most is how helpful the video can be and the information it carries. I don't think anyone will really care about the bearded face; they might even not notice it if they are getting what they want from the video. So just be you and do you. Why do your video compromise your beliefs? It's not an option, and even if you don't want to show your face, there are also possible ways of sharing videos without showing one's face. Only the voice and illustration of what's being discussed will be visible.

comments.author: robelneo
comments.body: Bitcoin niche is very competitive but that doesn't mean that we already have enough videos for people who want to look for information about Bitcoin, I'm sure with the knowledge you've had you have the edge over your competitors,  people will not mind the looks the most important is content and the way you explain it.Just use the best camera and the best microphone and you're good to go, you already have a group of subscribers and that is the Bitcointalk community and as you go and improve and cover a lot of topics about Bitcoin and what's happening around the industry, things will be easy for you and maybe one day you can do a live video or AMA ask me anything.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: If you want to do it because you simply just want to, then go ahead. I'll surely watch it because I'd likely find it interesting. Otherwise — if you expect to actually make decent money off this, I think the chances are slim. Interest in such stuff from the masses is simply not that high.

comments.author: Jet Cash
comments.body: Well thanks for all the positive encouragement. The UK gov thinks that statistically I've got about another 8 years to go, but that I have a 2.8% chance of living to be over 100. Personally I think I've just entered middle age, but aybe I'm delusional.I did think of having a Bitcoin specific channel, but I decided that would probably be preaching to the converted. I've spent quite a lot of time looking at Channel Makers and other YouTube educators, and I decided to focus on my less common characteristics. The core of this would seem to be my age - there isn't much for or about people over 60 or 70, and my decidsion to adopt the van life and Bitcoin. I'm also interested in preserving the environment, and the quality of life and health for the bulk of the population. That's why I decided to hang my chanel around the offgrid camper theme, with special emphasis on the advantages of being over 80. I scrub up well, so I've never been overly concerned about general appearance, but I used toi be concerned about detail. For example, did you know that traditionally gentlemen had 4 buttons on the cuffs of their suits, and servants had 3. However, I have had to adapt to current social norms where very few men wear suits any more. In fact about the only time I wear a suit is when I'm attending court, and I've had a load of civil actions in my life. Fortunately I've managed to avoid any criminal court appearances except as a juror. My thoughts on the beard were really based on the consideration of placing emphasis on my age. Apparently I look younger without it.I'm not sure that I'm qualified to start a Bitcoin specific channel, as there are many in this forum with a far greater knowledge of Bitcoin and its ooperation than me. I do think that I may have a good knowledge iof the way Bitcoin is adapting to the current banking and investment changes. Foe example, many people would rank the security of some assets in the fiollowing order - Property ( real estate ), fiat currency, and Bitcoin. With Bitcoin in a distant 3rd position. In fact I would reverse that order, and in justification, I would remind people that in the UK, the crown is the legal ownner of all property in the UK.Right now I'm experimenting with a Blue Yeti microphone attached to a Huawei core i5 matebook, and using OBS studiio to create videos. It's a pretty simple and basic setup, and it will allow me to get started. Getting started seems to be the most important first step.  I'm in Sainsbury's cafe, and I've decided that I need a pop filter, so I'm getting pretty close to submitting something foir general comment.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: Whether or not you shave your beard to look younger, it won't affect your appearance because you are young at heart. I know your age, but the way you participate in the forum and what you are so desperately passionate about make you much younger than those who do not know where and how to apply their strength and interest.I became your subscriber in advance, and I think that I will recommend your channel to my friends as a channel from a person who is quite unique and interesting. Knowledge about Bitcoin is important to people, and the more correct information people get, the more they will begin to believe in Bitcoin and not trust those who slander it so hard.

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.created_time: July 17, 2023, 06:30:36 AMLast edit: July 17, 2023, 07:44:47 AM by LoyceV
comments.body: Those 2 statements are not compatible at all:Quote from: Jet Cash on July 16, 2023, 11:34:22 AMObviously I want to appeal to as wide an audience as possibleQuote from: Jet Cash on July 16, 2023, 01:57:31 PMThat's why I decided to hang my chanel around the offgrid camper theme, with special emphasis on the advantages of being over 80.Let's get the data:Quote from: https://inews.co.uk/news/environment/cost-living-crisis-force-live-off-grid-communes-ben-fogle-1949163An estimated 150,000 people already live off-grid in the UK and the number is believed to be rising steeply.That's 0.25% of the population. Even less of them will be living in campers.The population above 80 years is about 5%. The percentage of people that own Bitcoin isn't that large either. That makes your target audience a niche within a niche within a niche (although I realize some of the niches can overlap).If you want to appeal to a wide audience, you'll have to make it interesting to watch even for the people who will never do it by themselves. Many people seem to be interested in off-grid life:3 days solo survival: 28 million views.Winter survival shelter: 23 million views.Building off grid cabin in the woods: 24 million views.Most people will never do it, but it's nice to watch for people stuck in city life. Like me.

comments.author: Accardo
comments.body: It's an interesting niche you want to venture into and it requires lots of work, drafting and planning of new contents. I'm sure you already have in place the topics and written scripts for the videos. Talking about vast topics, it'll be great especially when you're doing it to keep your self busy. But if you want to rank faster, focusing on bitcoin contents alone will help you achieve the goal. Can you do this for 5 years non stop? Chasing a long term goal pays off indeed. If you must add other topics always find a means to initiate bitcoin into the video, it'll help indicate to your audience that, at your old age, you're fully into bitcoin. With those hairs your videos can go viral, maybe when the audience gets bigger in size, you can shave them off to catch their attention and as well create room for further conversation in the comment section.

comments.author: Jet Cash
comments.body: I've decided I'm going with the vanlife theme, and I'll have a number of streams within that. I'm not sure how YouTube handles that concept. My feeling that adding a Bitcoin hashtag would allow people interested in Bitcoin to be selective. Other videos may not be of interest to them, especially the quirky ones. I'm going to interview my friend's Rottweiler/Staffie cross dog for example, and that won't appeal to everyone. I've just repaired the hissing brakes on my van at no cost, and that may be of general interest, and not just for owners of old LDV Convoy vans. I own the domain name Save Old Cars and this is another stream that I intend to include. This is a 1990 Volvo 740 that I own. I call it "The Hoe" because of the last 3 letters in its registration number. I plan to bring that up to show condition so that I can attend some classic car meets.With regards to the Bitcoin stream, I'm going to split the videos into a number of micro topics such as Blockchain, decentralisation/permissionless transfers, wallets, virtual assets as hard assets etc. I'd like to create initial videos, and have them peer reviewed in this forum. I can create updated videos with more authority. This is something that is/should be done in the medical profession, but it doesn't seem to be done with crypto. I'd be happy to give Bitcoin Talk the credit if that is within the rules here.I keep hitting setups, so I'm sorry for the delay in this project. I'm currently in the Morrison's cafe, and I'm trying to activate an old dash cam I bought some time ago. I'm having problems with the memory card. It wants a TD micro SD card, and I didn't realise that the TF format was used on the early cards. I've got loads of SD cards, but I'm not sure how to tell which are TF format. I may just buy a new dash cam, as this one uses the early USB cable with the V-shaped sides, and I've only got one suitable cable which I use on the Blue Yeti.

comments.author: KingsDen
comments.body: If this project is successful, it will be the second YouTube project that has strong affiliation to this forum. The other being BTC talks how was cool for the few times I followed up. I didn't know if it was Cyrus that was anchoring it.But this, I'm sure I'm gonna see Pa Jet Cash whether bearded or shaved.I really didn't think you would consider this, due to the extreme privacy believe of members of this forum. But then I am looking up to this project as I'll be among the first subscribers.

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: Quote from: Jet Cash on July 16, 2023, 11:34:22 AMguidance and experiences of running a full node in a campervan. Good luck finding members here with experience doing what you're doing.  I really, really doubt there are all that many living la vida van life like you are, and if anyone says they are you should ask for proof.  Aside from that, I give you mad props for dipping your octogenarian toes into all of these new technology....things.  You're not quite twice my age, but close enough and I bet you understand bitcoin and a lot of other things way more than I do.  Shame on me!  Good for you!Quote from: Jet Cash on July 16, 2023, 11:34:22 AMI can't even decide if I should shave off my beard for example.Keep the beard.  If you ever start bragging about how full it is or start calling attention to it in your Youtube videos, then it's a problem.  I can't tell you how many millenial generation beard-happy bros I've come across who've whipped out their back pocket comb and started to groom their prize-winning beard.  Just don't go there.I didn't read through this whole thread--are you going to link to your YT channel when you get it up and running?  I'll be happy to subscribe.  I actually started my own channel not too long ago, but it has nothing to do with bitcoin and everything to do with showing how shitty my town is and how tyrannical the police department is.  And one or more miscellaneous videos about that guinea pig I rescued.  Heh heh.
